alert.note: Alert for Mathews (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 1:46AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN MATHEWS COUNTY THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 144 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over the Chesapeake Bay near New Point Comfort moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Mathews County, including the following locations... Diggs, Ruff, Moon, Peary, Laban, Cardinal, New Point, and Port Haywood. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
